What are some key features of the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network, and how do they enable the creation of new blockchains and liquidity pools?

The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network offers several key features that enable the creation of new blockchains and liquidity pools. These features include:

**Simultaneous Blockchain and Liquidity Pool Launches:**
Verus allows for the simultaneous launch of a new blockchain and a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain and runs on the new blockchain, with all fees generated going to the new blockchain. This provides seamless connectivity between the new blockchain and other chains in the Verus network.

**Blockchain-based Crowdfunding Currency Launches:**
Verus enables blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds. This means that creators can set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on the chain. If the minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, less network fees. Additionally, launch options can include maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, and vesting schedules.

**Interoperable, Multichain Network:**
The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking. This enables unlimited scale and new use cases for blockchains, as well as seamless connectivity between different chains in the Verus network.

Overall, these features make it possible for creators to launch new blockchains and liquidity pools with ease, while also providing a high degree of flexibility and customization. Additionally, the Verus network's interoperable, multichain design enables unlimited scale and new use cases for blockchains.

### Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
### Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
### An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network.
